thread.title: 3 HRs lead Cubs over the Cardinals in Game 4 of NLDS; St. Louis eliminated
thread.title_full: 3 HRs lead Cubs over the Cardinals in Game 4 of NLDS; St. Louis eliminated

title: 3 HRs lead Cubs over the Cardinals in Game 4 of NLDS; St. Louis eliminated
text:
3 HRs lead Cubs over the Cardinals in Game 4 of NLDS; St. Louis eliminated POSTED: 07:03 PM CDT Oct 13, 2015 UPDATED: 07:37 PM CDT Oct 13, 2015 Tweet 
CHICAGO, IL - OCTOBER 13: Kevin Siegrist #46 of the St. Louis Cardinals reacts after giving up a solo home run to Anthony Rizzo #44 of the Chicago Cubs (not pictured) in the sixth inning during game four of the National League Division Series between the Chicago Cubs and the St. Louis Cardinals at Wrigley Field on October 13, 2015 in Chicago, Illinois. (Photo by Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images) CHICAGO, Ill. - 
The Chicago Cubs again turned up the power again to defeat the St. Louis Cardinals 6-4, winning the National League Division Series. 
The Cubs advanced to the National League Championship Series to play either the New York Mets or the Los Angeles Dodgers. It is the first postseason series win for Chicago since 2003. 
The Cardinals quickly jumped on the Cubs in the first. Matt Carpenter singled. Stephen Piscotty then smoked a home run for an early 2-0 lead. The Cubs regained the lead off the bat of Javier Baez in the second-inning. His three-run home run capped a four-run inning. The Cardinals added two runs in the sixth-inning. But the Cubs power returned with a solo home run from Anthony Rizzo in the sixth-inning. Kyle Schwarber crushed a solo home run in the seventh-inning. 
The Cubs used seven relievers. The last four combined to shut out the Cardinals the last three innings. 
Copyright 2015, Schurz Communications
